doc.previous: The ragwort or cushag is the Manx national flower 82
doc.after: The predominant religious tradition of the island is Christianity Before the Protestant Reformation the island had a long history as part of Catholic Christendom and in the years following the Reformation the religious authorities on the island and later the population of the island accepted the religious authority of the British monarchy and the Church of England 83 It has also come under the influence of Irish religious tradition The island forms a separate diocese called Sodor and Man which once comprised the medieval kingdom of Man and the Isles Sudrys in Old Norse It now consists of 16 parishes 84 and since 1541 85 has formed part of the Province of York 86
